title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110 in the NBA Cup, marking their first defeat in the tournament.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from three, going 1-for-6 against the Magic.
The Magic capitalized on three-point shooting, making 17 of 36, while the Celtics faltered with weak defense and turnovers.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety in a 2018 ICE-related case.
Massachusetts judge Joseph cleared of misconduct but involved in incident aiding immigrant to evade ICE arrest.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after she agreed to a state misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future after a playoff elimination by the Yankees.
Boston's postseason exit followed a third-place division finish with an 89-73 record and roster changes, including losing Alex Bregman.
Cora cites key performances and future potential from players like Roman Anthony as reasons for hope in upcoming seasons.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A blade broke off a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, falling into a cranberry bog on Friday afternoon.
No injuries occurred after the blade fell into the bog off Head of the Bay Road, and the turbine shut down safely.
The scene was secured and cleaned, and MassDEP will investigate with Inspectional Services to address the incident.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' streaming on Disney+ offers a new adaptation of Marvel's superhero family.
Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' presents a unique take on the classic novel, streaming on Netflix.
'Death by Lightning,' a series on President James A. Garfield's assassination, is now available on Netflix.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs leads the Patriots in receiving yards, targets, and receptions, contributing to their six-game win streak.
Diggs aims to improve his attitude, seeking perfection and managing his competitive nature more effectively.
Offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels and WRs coach Todd Downing are praised by Diggs for fostering growth and opportunity.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train struck an unoccupied vehicle at a Central Street crossing in Acton, pushing it 300 feet.
The crash occurred at 5:30 p.m., causing Fitchburg line delays; all train passengers were uninjured.
The car's driver, who exited before impact, will receive a citation for driving around closed crossing gates.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Japanese star Munetaka Murakami, known as the 'Japanese Babe Ruth,' has been posted as a potential MLB free agent.
Murakami, 25, hit 142 home runs in the NPB from 2022-2025, leading analysts to consider him a top free-agent hitter.
The Red Sox, along with several other MLB teams, are reportedly interested in signing Murakami before the Dec. 22 deadline.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds after FAA cut flights by 10% at 40 airports due to a government shutdown.
JetBlue, Southwest, United, American, Delta, and Spirit provide options like rebooking or full refunds for affected travelers.
Travelers at Logan Airport are advised to check with airlines for flight changes due to anticipated delays and cancellations.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod crash involving Lynne Forester has prompted calls for stricter Massachusetts e-bike regulations.
78% of 580 surveyed readers favor tougher e-bike laws; 20% oppose, citing ineffectiveness in improving safety.
Massachusetts currently categorizes e-bikes into two classes, with Class 3 bikes unregulated and safety concerns rising.
